messageBody:
amd64_hacker scripsit:

> But I still have a list of every word in the text on my hard drive (2940
> in total, including zik, zizzy and zuzzy).

Better yet, why bother with translating books at all? Just take a wordlist
sorted in order of frequency, and translate down it until you get
sick of the job. Then translating books is easy.

(You'll have to special-case heteronyms like _row_ and _desert_.)

A nice little demo for spelling reform is the poem "English is
Tough Stuff" at http://www.jokes2go.com/poems/7237.html .

--
John Cowan cowan@...
"Mr. Lane, if you ever wish anything that I can do, all you will have
to do will be to send me a telegram asking and it will be done."
"Mr. Hearst, if you ever get a telegram from me asking you to do
anything, you can put the telegram down as a forgery."
